ygData.subject: Tamino and PUT
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve been working with the Tamino WebDAV Server and found that its implementation of PUT stores the entity using the XML infoset and not a byte-for-byte copy.

I've been working with the Tamino WebDAV Server and 
found that its imple=
mentation of PUT stores the 
entity using the XML infoset and not a byte-fo=
r-byte
copy. For example, PUT-ing:

  <test></test>

will be retrieved usin=
g GET as:

  <test/>

I know this issue has come up several times on this
l=
ist, but it is interesting to see that one major vendor
at least has interp=
reted the semantics of PUT in a data-centric
way as opposed to a document-c=
entric way.  I tend to agree
with their approach as it makes PUT much more =
useful.

Still, is Tamino wrong?  Why?

- Jeff
